title: bitcoinsimulator
author: bitcoinsimulator
created_time: July 17, 2022, 06:45:33 PMLast edit: July 18, 2022, 01:21:07 AM by bitcoinsimulator
content: Hello there,I wanted to share and get feedback on an iOS App I have made called Bitcoin Simulator. It's a trading simulator app.It's free to download and use.I first launched it in 2017 but recently I revamped the UI and added more features. I also added a $100 Trading Competition that runs monthly.Any feedback is helpful and appreciated.You can check it out here: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/bitcoin-simulator/id1243328672

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Maybe I would have checked out the app and helped with some feedback, but unfortunately, I don't use iOS and i believe most people here are in the same boat like me. Any plans of releasing the android version of the app?The app could also do well with a website where one can check for more details and updates about the project, if possible.

comments.author: bitcoinsimulator
comments.body: Hello, we do have a website: https://www.bitcoinsimulatorapp.comOur background is in iOS apps, if this app becomes profitable we would make an Android one but at the moment it doesn't make sense for us.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Quote from: bitcoinsimulator on July 18, 2022, 01:20:47 AMHello, we do have a website: https://www.bitcoinsimulatorapp.comOur background is in iOS apps, if this app becomes profitable we would make an Android one but at the moment it doesn't make sense for us.At least try to focus on the web version because it is difficult to trust a random program or at least the user will need to try it on browser before deciding to download the application.How will the application be funded if everything is free?Will the user need to add exchange API if he learns (have a live tap and Simulator tap) or not ask for any data from the user?Do you sell ads?

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: bitcoinsimulator on July 17, 2022, 06:45:33 PMAny feedback is helpful and appreciated.I don't have Apple device, but is it true that your app also support macOS? If yes, you should mention it on this thread as well to potentially see more feedback.Quote from: Husires on July 18, 2022, 11:13:43 AMHow will the application be funded if everything is free?If you check their App Store page, it has 3 "In-App Purchases".Quote from: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/bitcoin-simulator/id12433286721. Pro Trading $1.992. Pro Trading $11.993. Remove Ads $14.99

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: bitcoinsimulator on July 18, 2022, 01:20:47 AMOur background is in iOS apps, if this app becomes profitable we would make an Android one but at the moment it doesn't make sense for us.Funny thing that this trading simulator is classified as a game in Apple store You previously said that your iOS trading simulator app is free for download and use, but I guess this is only partially true.I personally wouldn't pay for some app to teach me how to trade, but you are missing a big market share if you don't have Android version app.

comments.author: bitcoinsimulator
comments.body: The statement is completely true. The app is free to download and use.One can remove ads and access features *immediately* by subscribing but all functionality is possible without paying a dime.You certainly don't have to pay us anything and we don't claim to teach you how to trade, but rather provided a simulated environment so people can practice/try trading before spending real money.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: bitcoinsimulator on July 18, 2022, 10:29:13 PMThe statement is completely true. The app is free to download and use.One can remove ads and access features *immediately* by subscribing but all functionality is possible without paying a dime.You certainly don't have to pay us anything and we don't claim to teach you how to trade, but rather provided a simulated environment so people can practice/try trading before spending real money.I have stock iPhone 6 but it seems it does not support only Iphone 6s above can able to install this simulator app. So you mean people who want to use your Simulator for free can able to access all features but it has annoying ads?It's just like on Android games you can only earn or can continue to play their game if you watch some ads or answer some surveys. And paid one is by removing the ads?Are these reviews from AppleStore are real? Sorry but for me, I can't trust this app and actually there are lots of online trading tools or apps that you can able to use for free.

comments.author: bitcoinsimulator
comments.body: Apple automatically makes it available for MacOS but it is not designed for MacOs and therefore will likely be a sub par experience.Interesting I did not realize we did not support iPhone 6 and below, though we do only support iOS 14+ because we built this on SwiftUI.As far as trusting the app, there isn't really anything to "trust". We don't ask for personal information, we don't have accounts, there is no risk associated with using the app.Yeah the reviews are real actually.Maybe this is the wrong place for us to post for feedback, as you are all relatively seasoned bitcoin investors or at least people with a good fundamental knowledge of Bitcoin. While our app mainly targets people who are brand new to trading Bitcoin. Nevertheless it is interesting to see the general feedback about a lack of "trust". This is interesting to me just given what is from my perspective the absolute no risk nature of our app, but I think in crypto in general people are skeptical of any project and rightfully so. I'll think about how to improve the messaging/branding to make it more clear.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I don't know, but you target a small market share, which is the people who have iPhone 6+ compared to the number of iPhone users, compared to the number of users of other operating systems, compared to the number of users who do not use phones (computers and iPads) and part of the features of your application are paid, I do not know, but you will have a hard time Promote your app to this target audience.It will be difficult to get reviews, as your APP is closed source and there are many competitors, but features are what will force people to download your application, so it must be distinguished.
